result.execSummary:
The defendant Rani Bell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: any other sentence being served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Court Courts WAIVED, defendant Indigent.  DNA to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Mental Health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Not to use or possess of synthetic drugs or CBD products.
Not to use or possess of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with the Victim Business.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done.
Attend Domestic Violence counseling through a State Batterers Intervention program such as Alliance Counseling or Family Services of Waukesha.
Not to be present on any premises whose primary business is serving alcohol (bars, taverns, or liquor stores)
Attend at least 2 self help meetings per week.
